intro: Scleria multifoliata var. ophirensis, commonly known as the Ophirensis泽兰, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features a basal rosette of lanceolate, glaucous leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces tall, slender flowering stems that bear clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
